alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Gove; Graham; Norton; Sheridan (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 30 at 5:50PM CDT until June 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Norton County in northwestern Kansas... Sheridan County in northwestern Kansas... Decatur County in northwestern Kansas... Western Graham County in northwestern Kansas... Northern Gove County in west central Kansas... * Until 700 PM CDT. * At 549 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Menlo, or 14 miles west of Hoxie, moving east at 30 mph. An additional severe storm was located south of Oberlin. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Hoxie and Morland. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 81 and 103. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
